card

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • card.Card

  • public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
    This class models a playing card used in games like Solitaire and Black Jack.
    It has two attributes:
    • rank (the numerical value of the card)
    • suit (which family the card belongs to)
    Thus the two of clubs has rank 2, and suit "Clubs". Aces have rank 1. Jacks Queens, and Kings have ranks 11, 12, and 13 respectively.
    Author:
    Richard Douglas

    • Constructor Detail

      • Card

        public Card(int rank,
    java.lang.String suit)
        Initializes Card with the specified rank and suit.
        Parameters:
        rank - must be >= MIN_RANK and <= MAX_RANK.
        suit - must be in SUITS.

    • Method Detail

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        returns a String representation of Card of form "'rank' of 'suit'" taking into account that certain ranks aren't interpretted as numbers. (e.g. A rank of 1 corresponds to an "'ace' of 'suit'".)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
